intro: Mukia rottleri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, velvety flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of tubular or campanulate flowers in shades of violet, pink, and white. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. Mukia rottleri is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
